Posts.Content: nbare1952 wrote: Hi girls I took two doses and was supposed to get my third on Wednesday but my white blood was too low. 1.4 to be exact.  I was tearfully sent home with an antibiotic and told that I will not get a treatment until the 29th.  I felt fine so I was kind of surprised and very sad.  My onc said this is not unusual and all is well.  I have two small spots on my lung and it is not life threatening but it scares me that I might not be able to take this chemo even though I had the option of taking nothing for a while.  Now I am finding myself extremely tired.  Tired in the way that I want to stay in bed and sleep all day.  This could be depression but I was wondering if this is a side effect of the chemo as well.  Just scared....I could use some encouragement...and I know that I can get that here. Love, Nancy  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Please help with questions about navybean nbare1952 chainsawz

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 01:50PM - edited Feb 19, 2012 01:52PM by nbare1952  Thanks girls, I know I can count on you.  I was just so bummed to hear my counts were so low.  I felt pretty good and was so disappointed not to get treatment.  I have two gradchildren due in August and a wedding in June 2013.  I told my onc I needed two more years and he said he was thinking more like ten or twenty.  He is the greatest!
Posts.Title: Please help with questions about navybean nbare1952 chainsawz

Posts.Content: nbare1952 wrote: I was just wondering if any of you wonderful ladies who believe in God and the power of prayer can still pray?  I cannot pray anymore.  I mumble the words or think them in my head but those words or thoughts do not connect to my heart or soul any longer. I not only cannot pray for myself, I cannot pray for anyone else either.  I want to and I say I will and I even do but the words are empty.  Everytime someone asks for prayers on this site or elsewhere I always bow my head and say a prayer but I no longer believe that prayers are answered. There have been so many brave women on this site who have lost their fight and so many others who continue fighting with such strength and courage.  Earthquakes take thousands of lives.  Countries still fight and kill each other.  People still lie, hurt and kill each other.  Today I found out that the daughter of friend has juvenile diabetes.  She is two years old.  I wish I could pray, really pray for her and others. Any thoughts??? Love, Nancy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Can you pray? nbare1952 cancersuks

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2010 05:58AM nbare1952 wrote: Thanks to all of you who replied.  I am once again amazed by the strength and faith and courage of all of us on this site.  I felt better after posting the question but your inspiring responses made me feel even better.  I know that I am not alone and that is a beautiful thing.  To those of you who find yourself feeling much the same way I do I hope you received some comfort and maybe an oar or two from the responses. To those of you who can and do still pray thank you for helping me to realize that I am still praying even when I think I am not and that even when I cannot pray God hears me and wipes away my tears.  Thank you and God bless you. Nancy T
Posts.Title: Can you pray? nbare1952 cancersuks

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2012 09:07AM nbare1952 wrote: I had it done on the recommendation of my SIL who is a nurse and a fateful meeting with a pathologist whose wife had had it done. The sample was taken during initial breast biopsy. Interestenly enough at the time not every surgeon or oncologist would do it. The pathologist referred me to his wife's doctors. I started TAC right away because the cancer was pretty bad. The results came back saying those drugs would work and they did for awhile. I have done many chemo s since. Hugs Nancy

Posts.Content: nbare1952 wrote: I keep thinking of the Wizard of Oz.  I am definetly the lion in search of courage.  My most recent scans (November) were awsome but now the potassium does not want to remain in he normal range.  The last four or five times I have had to have a four hour drip of potassium.  Much of this is my fault because I was unable to take the horse pills as often as needed.  They did change them to plastic coated pills which are much more tolerable.  I was supposed to take two a day only to find out yesterday they thought my perscription was for 20 mg but it was only 10mg.  Now I am supposed to be take four a day.  Also tomorrow I have to see a kidney specialist and this lion is scared beyond belief.  Am I on a downward slide??  I was diagnosed with stage IV four years ago in my head I know people are lucky to live five.  Help???  Please!! Posts.Content: nbare1952 wrote: Hi Ladies, There is a relatively new treatment for neuropathy called p stim. It is FDA and Medicare approved. It is acupuncture in your ear. My oncologist had not heard of it but it turns out a radiation oncologist who also practices alternative medicine was familiar with it. They put a device in your ear. The device needs to be replaced every four days. It works best if you are not on a chemo that causes neuropathy. They had a patient who had not driven in years and she was driving after twelve treatments. I tried it with some success while on Havalen which causes neuropathy. I am going to try it again now that I am on a/a. On the downside you have to go back every four days and cannot get it wet. It was not really painful although you may hear a buzzing noise. I hope this helps! Nancy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: P Stim for neuropathy nbare1952 nbare1952

Posts.Content: nbare1952 wrote: Hello Ladies, I have not posted in a long time and when it did it was in the stage III topic area.  As of February of this year I am a stage iv with microscopic cancer in my hip.  They actually think it has been there since my diagnosis of stage III in January of 2007.  At that time I was told it was arthiritis.  The met was confirmed with a biopsy in February.  I had no real symptoms.  I am fifty five years old and although I had some pain it was not something I even took over the counter drugs for.  I finished twenty five radiation treatments the end of April.  I have been on Zometa monthly since March.  I am going for scans in August.  I still have some discomfort in my hip.  Again it is nothing major but now everything scares me to death.  Do you think I can relax and enjoy the first part of the summer?  Love and prayers to all of you and thank you for your response. Nancy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hip Pain nbare1952 wishiwere

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2012 11:51PM nbare1952 wrote: I am so happy for you Leah!
Posts.Title: Good news! Leah_S DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2008 12:16PM nbare1952 wrote: I was a stage IIIc when I was first diagnosed in January of 2007.  I had a bone scan at that time and an area on my right hip showed up.  At the time the doctors/radiologist said it was arthiritis.  I never had any pain that I needed to take anything for.  I am fifty five and the little pain I occasionally had I attributed to my age and arthiritis.  I had six TAC treatments, a bilateral masectomy and I forget how many radiation treatments.  About six weeks after radiation was completed my oncologist (a very kind and thorough man) ordered a pet scan and cat scan. Nothing of concern showed up except this same area of the hip.  This time the radiologist recommended a MRI.  The MRI was inconclusive.  My oncologist suggested we wait a few months and do another pet/cat scan.  Again in February the area showedup and this time it was a little more inflamed. I then had a bone biopsy.  Microscopic cancer cells were present.  I finished twenty five radiation treatments in April and have been on monthly Zometa since the end of February.  My oncologist is very hopeful that the radiation zapped the cancerous cells in my hip and that the Zometa will strengthen my bones.  The only time I had any pain requiring pain medication was after the biopsy.  I still have occasional discomfort in my hip and it scares me because I thought the radiation would relieve any pain I had.  I will have scans in August. I would not worry too much if you are a Stage I although I would certainly mention any new pain or concerns to my doctor.   It is always better to be safe than sorry. We will always worry.  That is our new normal.  I guess the key is not letting fear dictate how we live our lives. I will pray for you. Love, Nancy
Posts.Title: Hip Pain nbare1952 wishiwere

Right now I just want to quit and say uncle. Thanks Nancy Prayers for everyone but especially those in path of the storm. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Antidepressant nbare1952 kayrnic

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2013 09:50AM nbare1952 wrote: No trouble at all with insurance. My hands and feet were/are pretty numb and painful. I also had some back pain from Mets to hip which have been radiated. The back pain went away almost right away and has not come back. The neuropathy improved about 50%. I cannot drive and I really want to be able to again. I had about eight treatments. Because I was Havalen it seemed like it would improve only to get worse again. I just called today and plan to start again next week. Now I am on a/a. We are all so different but I would give it a try. Best of luck to you!

Posts.Content: nbare1952 wrote: Hello Everyone, I had a PET/CAT scan on Saturday so I will have the results soon enough.  I was originally diagnosed in January of 07.  I had six TAC treatments, surgery and radiation.  In February of 08 I was diagnosed with microscopic cancer in my right hip.  I had twenty five radiation treatments in an effort to kill all the cancer cells. I really had no pain in the hip or at least no pain that I would have questioned if I did not have breast cancer.  After the radiation I had periods of fairly bad pain for a few weeks.  From what I have read this is not unusual.  For the last few days I have had some pain again.  What has your experience been with radiation to your hip?  I know I still have some discomfort in my chest due to the radiation there.  Of course I jump every time the phone rings.  I really do not expect results today.  Maybe I will get them tomorrow or Wednesday.  One minute I want to know and the next minute I think I can be happy in la la land forever. Any and all prayers would be appreciated too.  You all are always in my thoughts and prayers. Love, Nancy Log in to post a reply
